alert.note: Alert for Collier (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Collier. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 642 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains due to slow thunderstorms moving southward through Northwest Collier County. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area with these slow moving storms. This rainfall amounts could result in minor flooding as the grounds are saturated from the heavy rains last weekend. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Naples, Golden Gate Estates, Ave Maria, Immokalee, Orangetree, Big Corkscrew Island, Vineyards, Golden Gate, North Naples, Naples Park, Corkscrew Swamp Sanctuary, Quail Creek Estate, Lake Trafford and Pelican Bay. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
